values: "When a relationship dies, do we ever really give up the ghost, or are we forever haunted by the spirits of relationships past?"

Gosh. 

So today did not start out the best. I'm dumpy. hmmh.

Last night would have been fantastic. I had a great time seeing friends who I hardly see at all anymore because of my effing 19hrs and all that they entail. I danced like mad. It was great music as usual. I miss the Thursday nighters at the Cellar. I'm so glad I was able to go out. 

Just as the night was winding and the lights came up, there was drama. Good gosh, drama. Justin said to my comment of "I hate this shit. Drama!": "It's amazing that it always seems to find you as much as you hate it." Seriously, I say. 

Paul, the FUCKING ASS, ended up there. No surprise. Actually expected it. When he tried to dart me a what's up nod, I turned away. I'm still rightfully angry with him for his comment to my big brother, on his wedding night of all nights, that was not in anyway necessary or acceptable. AND for his ridiculous behavior towards my lovely cousin. She deserves so much fucking better. 

Lauren, as mixed up as she is, has such a rough time with it. I tried to keep her away from him, but in the end she ended up talking to him anyway. She was pretty stubborn last night which didn't make it any easier on Shekina and me. 

When Laur was chatting with him I tried pulling her away but she snapped at me which pissed me off more because he's no good for her and she knows it. So I decided fine, and I walked away from it like I always want to. Shekina stayed and chatted some advice into his ear about how he should be treating Lauren. All I want is for him not to be treating her at all, but not in her life. Luckily Lauren went to dance with a friend of her's that she saw across the floor so she wasn't near him any longer at this point. 

I guess maybe Shekina's talking to him sparked some kind of humility in Paul because he came up to me, which I didn't like. I told him I didn't want to talk, to which he told me he "probably shouldn't even say anything right now," to which I asked him, "Then why are you?" 
 
I kept trying to push him away and turn away. Poor Shae and Bunny were standing behind me not having an effin clue. But Paul insisted on trying to tell me that he didn't know the situation the night of the wedding and that he didn't mean to say anything. I'm baffled at how many things he says and "doesn't really mean." I told him (all the while being interrupted with more 'I didn't mean it"s) "I really don't care. It's not okay. You don't mess with my brother. You upset him on his wedding night and that's not cool at all. You need to just leave cause I don't want to talk to you." So he loudly called me a dike and told me to go fuck myself as he back away. 
 
I was angered at the whole thought again of everything he's done and how much of an effing idiot he is, but trying to cool off. So then, here comes more baffling, a minute later he comes BACK up to me and tells me, "I didn't mean to say that. I meant something else that I didn't say," a comment which in itself is baffling. But what the hell? You know? Geeeez. I just shook my head and he spouted off another "fuck you" and I hugged my boys and left. 
 
I knew Lauren was in her car sitting her drunk out, but I didn't know where Shekina went so I called Lauren to check on her and then Shekina to tell her about what I'd had to deal with. She came outside and told me that he talked to her after he talked to me and apparently "Fuck [our] whole family. [We're] all bitches." 
 
I'm so done with him. I'm glad I handled myself the way I did. Walking away is always better. I hate drama. Uhh. 
 
Lauren and I talked today. She apologized for everything again, but I'm tired of her apologies....the ones for Paul. She knows he's bad for her, she knows she needs to get away from and over him, and I believe she wants to. She's just really mixed up and it's hard, when you care about someone so much to focus on their faults and really think about the bad stuff all the time when you really only remember the good. I've been there and it sucks, but I had to figure out on my own that I was better off. No one else could make me feel that no matter how much I was told. I know Lauren needs to do that too. Only she can. So I'm just going to do what I can, when I can, to keep her away from him and support her. I love her to death and hate to see her go through all of this shit and be treated so badly. I know she'll figure things out and that she's even better off than she was before this and she's getting closer everyday, but it does take time. It took me months to even realize how terrible things were in my situation and how much better off I was without that guy. It changed me for the better and I know it will her too. I know more about myself and after going through all of it, it even helped realize some things later about Eric and me along our journey and I think that's proved to be one of the driving forces that has enabled us to stay friends. It's funny how past relationships can better future or present ones.
 
I'm sometimes amazed at how much I've been through and how learned I feel at times when I'm giving advice to others who are experiencing what I have in the past. I'm grateful for every mistake I've made.

I think if Trick and Liz didn't get married, it wouldn't really feel so new. But they did. :)

The wedding was amazing. The whole process, though stressful even for me at times, was fun, and I've always been the kind of girl to feel like I can't wait till that's me. Even if I'm single right now and will be for awhile, I've always been waiting for my wedding. :) 

The rehearsal dinner was good fun. I'm glad that their friends are all really cool and funny and that Lizzie's family is awesome. The food at the Hilton was A-MAZ-ING. Seriously. I gave my toast. I shook for about 5min after, but everybody told my it was really good. 

Thursday was spent shopping for bras to wear with the dress, picking up programs, tying ribbon on to each one(while watching: Truman Show and Titanic), re-hemming my dress, Gold Star for dinner, showering, and coloring the amazing sign with Michael D. (Trick's friend) for the Ushers to bust through at the reception entrance. I was up too late, but I looked okay the next day thanks to Preparation H (unused on the ass) on the eyes and make-up. :)

Friday was fun all day. Even though we were up early, the hair and make-up process was a good time. The ceremony was so great and I had such a good time being in the wedding party. First bridesmaid experience (hey and limo ride) thank you. I didn't cry nearly as much as I anticipated which is good. I only used one tissue. hah. It still feels different having Patrick married though. It's kind of surreal. 

The limo was the best. It was huge - we called it the "semi." haha. After the ceremony we all had our champagne and little Col Ball had his coke. He was so cute in his little tux. He did a great job as ring bearer. We bumped some music though and laughed a lot. 

The PAR-TAY was great too. Food - amazing, drinks - great, music - so awesome. I shook it all night long. heh heh. :) Some of us gathered at the Pub after and that was fun. I was tired after that though so I didn't go to any after-after parties. 

It was THE best wedding I have EVER been to. Patrick and Elizabeth are so effing perfect for each other. I'm so, so jealous of the kind of love they have. I used to think about how I would have a hard time finding the kind of love my parents have, and maybe it's just cause I'm closer to it, but I think it'll be harder to get what Trick and Liz have. They're going to be so happy together. I'm so glad Lizzie is our sister-in-law because she's amazing. She's kind, intelligent, and beautiful and she just fits into our family so perfectly. 

For New Year's Eve I went to Ron's with the Hunt girls :), Shekina, and Clarey. It was a really good time. I had a lot of fun.

New Year's Day, the family did our annual movie and dinner. Then we stopped by the Grandparent's Hartman to visit with relatives in town. 

E and I got coffee at Perkin's after that. It was so good to see him. We rented a couple movies and hung out all night. I've missed his company so much with our busy schedules. 

I guess the new year is here though. I'm tired of school and I don't want to go back. oh I'm so sick of the 19hrs. I'm stressed because of it and poor because of it. I'm so over education at this moment. I know I need it and want it, but I'm really NOT into it right now. Not at all. I want my life. I don't feel like I have it yet. I'm just breathing right now though, so God, get me through this. Go back tomorrow, yuck. I hope this month goes by fast. I already need that break at the end of the month.

I should get ready for bed soon so I'm out.

Things are beginning to get slightly crazy. It feels like time is flying. I feel like there's so much for me to do, but I can't think of anything. I just keep telling Patrick, "Let me know what I can do, or what needs to be done." 

Clare and I bought a Christmas tree from Sears today with white lights, pre-lit, for the reception. it's a very cute idea to have them. Christmas as a presence with make the whole thing that much better. 

The seating arrangements are being taken care of tonight. I have a feeling that's going to have a late ending. Pray for my brother he has a sore throat three days before his big day. 

Tomorrow is the rehearsal dinner. I'm sucking it up and giving a toast. I feel like it's a really nice thing to do. I don't want to look back and think I wish I had said something. He's my big brother. 

Christmas was good. The Eve was cool. I went to church with the family this year because I didn't go to Eric's side obviously. It felt good. The time at home on Christmas Day was good, but I think it felt rushed at the relatives. It was nice, but I couldn't help feeling like something was lacking. I didn't feel as "togethered" this year. I thought about Eric's activities. We even talked for awhile when I was at the Stricker side festivities. I was glad to be able to. 

I haven't seen him in a week now and that's so strange. I don't really like it much at all. I guess that's one thing making me sad right now. That and the bittersweet of Patrick getting married. Things about Eric though aren't nearly as bad as they were.  

It's still not the best feelings I've had of course and I know I'm going to be single for a long while, but I'm doing better with the whole thing - there haven't been tears. I think that Christmas and the wedding have helped to distract me a lot and that's been good for me. But I do still miss him a lot at times. I guess I know it's better this way though. I just can't help sometimes to think about how hard we tried though. Cause we did. And sometimes that makes me thankful that we love each other that much and others it makes me bitter that it still didn't work out. "I am drawing the story of how hard we tried..."

Every morning here I wake up and I'm reminded of how much I don't want to go back to school. I'm not a school person and what my regret for having to go causes me to feel and think only makes me think I'm better off not getting a BA but just being happy with my AA. I think sometimes that thinking this is stupid, but there are times when I still feel like what the hell am I doing? 

Friday is going to be tremendous and emotional and wonderful. Note to self: bring extra tissues. I can't believe it's so close now. It's so weird - Patrick's getting married. Geeeez.

1) Was 2005 a good year for you?
I'd say over all yes - but honestly (and don't tell 2005, but) I've had better. :)

2) What was your favorite moment of the year?
It hasn't actually happened yet, but I think it's going to be Patrick and Lizzie's wedding. -going to effing rock.

3) What was your least favorite moment of the year?
Realizing that maybe love isn't enough to be a couple and thinking Grandma might die.

4) Where were you when 2005 began?
Out at the farm having chinese and sparkling grape juice with E.

5) Who were you with?
Eric - my boyfriend at the time

6) Where will you be when 2005 ends?
Maybe Ron's - he said he was having a party.

7) Who will you be with when 2005 ends?
My cousins probably and then Ron of course and his friends.

8) Did you keep your new years resolution of 2005?
I didn't make one for 2005

9) Do you have a new years resolution for 2006?
Write more.

10) Did you fall in love in 2005?
I was already in love when 05 hit.

11) If yes, with who?
Eric.

12) If yes, do they know?
Of course.

13) Are you still in love with them?
Yes.

14) Do you regret it?
Never.

Yes.

Yes. 

17) Who are your favorite new friends?
Probably Tiff because she and I are closest out of the people I met and I kind of still see.

I don't have one this year.

19) Did you travel outside of the US in 2005?
Nope.

20) How many different states did you travel to in 2005? 
Just one - TN

21) Did you lose anybody close to you in 2005? 
Not in the sense that they died.

22) Did you miss anybody in the past year?
YES!

23) What was your favorite movie that you saw in 2005?
Hmmm....either Jarhead, Shopgirl or King Kong. (If you know me, you know I can never pick just one)

24) What was your favorite song from 2005?
Now this one is tooo hard.

25) What was your favorite album from 2005?
X&Y - Coldplay
Mesmerize - System of a Down
Late Registration - Kanye West
Foo Fighters
And other good ones, but that's all I can think of right now.

27) Did you have a favorite concert in 2005?
Well....seee I just went to one so yeah I guess.

28) did you drink a lot of alcohol in 2005?
More than usual for me I think.

29) did you do a lot of drugs in 2005?
No.

30) How many people did you sleep with in 2005?
Just one

31) Did you do anything you are ashamed of this year?
I don't think so. 

32) What was the biggest lie you told in 2005?
I'm a man.

33) What was the worst lie someone told you in 2005?
"I don't talk to her."

34) Did you treat somebody badly in 2005?
Maybe without knowing.....?

35) Did somebody treat you badly in 2005?
Yes.

36) How much money did you spend in 2005?
Everything I've made.

37) What was your most embarrassing moment of 2005?
Getting angry-trashed and having my friends take care of me and them being told "she needs to go"

38) If you could go back in time to any moment of 2005 and change? 
Being friends with that asshole Ryan for that minute I was - or believing him. 

39) What are your plans for 2006?
Graduate from C-State, start school for my Bachelor's, write something good as much as possible, and learn - about myself, life, English, writing, people, everything.

*forgive me for being morose*


There are shadows falling on my violet walls. Shadows that cast this darkness that I not only see behind these objects, but that I feel inside. Scattered around me is the disaster that was born from my depression. Baskets of unfolded, and now wrinkled clothes sit on a floor much in need of vacuuming. My dresser and desk are unkempt, just the way I hate it. Cluttered in front of me are things that refresh just as much clutter in my mind of things I haven't done or need to remember. Empty frames I want to fill, favors or projects that remain untouched, and stacks of used cups from my nightly water. It all makes my emotion that much worse. 

I am not myself.

I have new pillows in my favorite cases and there seems nothing new about them except that they're one more thing that I have to get used to. We have our Christmas tree up and partially decorated and I was only excited and happy for about an hour. So very unlike me. 

Sometimes I feel like I've never felt more alone. I know that I have, but it's one of those moments when you're down and you just feel as if you can't ever get up or you'll never be yourself again. I'm looking for who I am right now and she's not here. I have moments where I feel like she's returned, but those moments are fleeting. My behavior is erratic and I hate it.

Some thing's gone and it's becoming physically taxing for me to hide it when I need to. I don't know how much longer I can keep this up. I'm going through something I don't want to be, that I don't understand and that literally makes me angry. I'm not coping with these changes. Sooner or later the shell is going to crack and I'm so afraid that I'll no longer be who I was...who I want to be...who I was finally happy with 

Life, especially Christmas, just IS NOT the same without me. It needs a band-aid, but I've run out of them. So frightened of bleeding to death.

it sucks when you love someone and they just aren't right for you. you want different things, you look at things differently, you need different things. it sucks because you love them but fundamentally it won't work. why does life have to be so fundamental? 

it's an extremely shitty thing to want to be with someone but when you try - and you try the hardest you've ever tried to do something (EVER) in your entire life - all that keeps happening no matter how long the good parts last is an end of the line that you must get off at. and no matter how much you may fight it, or wish you could ride forever, your shoes tell your feet it's time to go and you step off, still loving and missing the ride with ALL of your heart. damn those shoes for being right and smart and logical. damn them.

today i drove home from a long night of halo ass kicking and got one of the sensations that maybe all of us get every now and then. i honestly do not want to change my past because it's brought me here and made me who i am. still, from time to time, i get chills and cringe from thoughts of things i feel worse about having in my past. there are always things people regret. i do regret things. i know i do or i would not get that feeling. and i'm not lying when i say i wouldn't change anything, but i guess there's a balance of regret and acceptance for me. i just hate that regretful feeling because it's about nothing that can be changed and it's something that i can't ever fix or get rid of. regret is a part of all of us and i guess what makes me happier and better is that i accept it. i accept regret and i'm even thankful for it because it's the situations, things, and people i regret the most that i learn the most from.

i slept in till after noon.

i helped trick with the wedding invitations. -those of you who get one, i just may have put that stamp on :)

i fried bacon for bacon sandwiches. mmm.

hung out with e.

and with his help i picked up some stuff for trick and liz's gift of mine (and maybe clare's) for their couple's shower.

i vegged and vegged.

i made apple crisp for the family.

and i vegged some more and got caught up on some pop culture nonsense :) - you know me.

to bed i go now. :) it was a pleasant day despite the dumb warm weather that makes my sinuses punch me inside my head. hmmh. 

take care.

don't you wish you were an alison too?

all you need is an alison and a dream.

can't do it in real life? do it on al.

it's a bit of an alison.

think al.


alrighty that's it. out.

it's my 23rd birthday today. congratulate me for making it through this year. it's been one of the more taxing ones of my life. i have survived. and as i said to brett last week, "yeah, getting older has always brought me changes and i've always been happy to be that new person." 

i've changed every day of my life into a better person and i will continue to do so. i know it. 

even though i may complain and maybe sometimes life gets to me, i love my life and i'm so thankful to have been born and lived this long thus far.

happy birthday, al. 23 only comes once.

i haven't burnt candles i a long time and so i did today while i've been getting all my shit together. 

i'm registered for all my classes and them some. i still have to hear back from my advisor to be sure which ones i need to keep because i have more than enough to fill my distributives but need to be told by my advisor which courses can go towards my electives. why they can just print those out accordingly for majors on the evaluations like every other category is beyond me. 

and i'm about to look into georgetown, st. mary of the woods, and louisville for my bachelor's. i told e yesterday that it feels like high school looking at colleges, except this time i want to do it. waiting was good for me.

the terrible is fading. i can feel it. i'm still not about going out much - it comes and goes, but i'm not so depressed feeling. i don't know what's changed, but i'm not going to complain about not feeling like complaining. :) i just hope it lasts. i'm not really pessimistic about it but not optimistic either so we'll see. 

e and i had our first official date, but no, we're not back together. things are really good there and we're on our road to recovery. we went to dinner at york st. cafe since i haven't been there in ages and he never had. it's our new "nice place to eat" restaurant. the date was the most fun i've had on a first date since he and i had our first first date. hmmh. i'm extremely happy with the way things are and how they're going for us. 

i got to see angel today and that was good, though, as always because of life, it was too short a time we had to spend together. i've missed her. i hate not being able to see her any time i want. but she may be coming home next weekend too and i'm probably going down there the weekend of my bday for a halloween party which will be fun. i didn't get to dress up last year so i'm happy that i'll be able to probably twice this year. she and i got to catch up a little on things in our lives. we talked about how identical we are when it comes to our reactions and feelings. i'm so grateful to have a friend who's like a sister, literally. 

FYI to the friends if you want to come out for my birthday let me know. it's FRIDAY, OCTOBER 28. it's gonna be at BARLEYCORN'S in COLD SPRING but i'll let you know what time when i find out who wants to go etc.

irritating.

damn it.

sometimes people just suck an effing cock and it gets to me. but i want for it not to get to me. and honestly, half the time there's not a lot for me to be gotten to about. that doesn't stop the intense feeling to want to walk away when i really can't or to want to dig my nails into something destructible when i'm confronted with the things that now irk me. i want for me to be ME again. i haven't been in a month now. i know this because that's when all this started, when i started last month. and i'm on again. so normally i would chalk this up to being the cliche, but it didn't go away for the month in between.

it's so incredibly erratic and irritating that i genuinely want to just let my mouth open and let out the scream my clenched teeth are gating right now. i would seriously love a drive to the fuck the world spot. i haven't thought of that place in a while. angel remembers i'm sure. it's a good thing i haven't thought of that place in so long. i know it's because i haven't needed to in so long. i don't know why this shit's happening for me to need it now. i thought i was done with this sort of thing. i thought i was finally getting to life the way i wanted to. but in walks some jacked up mood swings, restless nights, and the after effects of stress and all of the above that my body feels.

when e and i split and i dealt with all of that, it destroyed me. but i got up again. this is the kind of thing that went on in high school, the kind of thing that won't let me get up. mainly because i've no effing clue why i feel this way so how to i remove the hands that are holding me down?

i'm exhausted but i don't want to sleep and then when i do sleep, i don't want to get up when i need to. it's taking it's toll.

i can't breathe.

i'm sick of complaining. sick of feeling sick. sick of needing to be put up with (even when i'm told i'm not someone to put up with). sick of needing an hour for wardrobe. sick of my body. sick of my eyes. sick of feeling trap.

jesus. just "un-trap" me.

fuck.

i'm actually feeling alright head/ear/sinus-wise today but my back isn't my friend because of that shitty thing called a period. blah. i thought last month was what i like to call balance time - the month that i experience an almost "what it was like before the pill" period - but here it is again. i don't know. at least it's not really the way it was without the pill. god, was that awful.

my mood is still fluctuating, up and down. it has nothing to do with time of day or activity. i still have no idea where it comes from. 

i love the weather. i am "home" because of it. people can sometimes have a type of depression that responds to the lack of sunlight that the change of season brings with fall and winter. i was always brought more happiness because of those changes of season. i guess i found more solitude in the kinds of things that fall and winter bring more than anything when i was ever sad during those seasons. i've always been a winter woman. and i love fall, but my heart can't wait for frost and snowflakes. you should hear it beat at the thought of them.

my day has consisted mostly of telling time, wishing i had more time, and enjoying what time i have.

the high point of my day was thai cafe. i hadn't been there in the longest time in the world. the taste of the duck and cafe spicy sauces were like memories in my mouth. clifton was busy and brutal and i loved it all.

i spent a good deal of time alone today, not thinking, which felt great. that went away after a few hours though and i was back to my "discouragement" about life. i just feel as if i need something else. or something should be different. still clueless about the source of these feelings. i should probably talk to shauna like lauren suggested.

i've gotten a lot of new music that i love so that's a good thing. 

i've been outrageously thirsty recently. all i do is drink water. and tea. 

hopefully i'll get in with the doc tomorrow. i meant to call today but i forgot to until it was too late to. 

i don't want to work tomorrow.

i'm amazed at the amount of time i haven't spent alone this week. i'm amazed at how little that's actually bothered me. 

i want the vintage pink dress that i couldn't fit into because it was either altered or i'm fat. i've felt the latter very much today, this week, this life. 

dave matthews is looking at me. his smile is not judging my abundant belly. or rosecea flushed face. or frown. 

my lips have been more chapped, my hands have been more dry, and my ears have been more clogged and sore this past week, i feel, than they ever have before.

i actually did my homework without crying today. i still feel un-enthused about the fact that school exists right now and that i'm a student in one.

the box of tacks in front of me urges me to find things to hang on walls and bulletin boards. i have nothing to hang.

tomorrow is supposed to feel like summer. i'm discouraged at the thought that fall is that much further from my grasp this year. i would love to stay inside alllll day and do nothing but watch movies i've never seen.

p.s. clare is coming home for good at the end of the semester. patrick passed the bar. eric is showing qualities daddy has. i'm going to try plum wine in a couple of weeks because elizabeth loves it. my birthday is in 24 days as of this very minute. i know what kind of future i want to wake up to. part of that is sitting across the room. daddy really takes care of all of us and i'm incredibly grateful for him. i have no stories in my head.

had the first ever sundrenched suck-ups practice today. we got a few things organized and we're hopefully going to have our next practice at a place that has a pa system. heck yes.

been hanging out with e a lot lately. it's good.  he's seriously a different person. i'm still needing some assurance and to learn to trust him more again. but he treats me like i'm the only thing that matters to him and i believe him. we're going to get back together eventually, but not now. he knows i need time and that's good. i love him.

in terms of happiness, i've been pretty good the past couple days. a lot of that i think is due to e. thank you, e. 

last night was fun, bunny's birthday. his mom made awesome pasta, etc. it was great. and i had a good time playin the drinking games. 


i'm extremely sleepy. but today has been good. going to dinner with the fam later too, to celebrate
trick passing the bar. w00t. i'm so proud of him.

might take a nap.

i agree. and though i can't wait for it to be here,  and though summer is my least favorite season, there are many things that no other season will this year.

my list of things i'm thankful to summer for:
-actually being tan enough for people to say, "you're so tan"
-the swim club
-the coconut smell of banana boat tan oil
-clare being home for a long stretch of time
-seeing angel twice in the span of a few weeks
-seeing the friends i hardly can even talk to now because things are so busy
-poker
-the dairy bar
-the funny sight of venven needing to cool off on the air conditioner vent
-being forced to drive with my windows down (i need the reality check, as effed up as that is)
-snocastle
-the smell of fresh cut grass and the sound of lawn mowers going (i know i'm weird)
-sleeping in
-dollywood
-gatlinburg
-barleycorn's
-beer cellar
-not needing to smoke a cigarette badly enough to do it (huge accomplishment)
-lauren becoming one of my best friends
-the music i discovered (some songs will always be summer songs)
-the cousin's night we had at lan's before she left for school
-eric and i breaking up (even though i hated it, he's better for it and we're better for it and we're in a good place now and it's going to make us even better for it later - good has come from it)
-cook outs
-the pictures i took
-the people i met
-patrick's grad party
-shauna's grad party
-being asked to be in patrick and liz's wedding
-feeling relaxed
-the things i did and the fun i had

and i can't wait for fall to be here. maybe it will bring good things to me.

i've been doing better with the whole sailor mouth lately. i think it's because i've added the phrase "ah geez" to my vocab. it's the strangest thing. i didn't do it on purpose, yet here it is spilling out of my mouth. "fuck," "fucking," "shitty," and "shit" are all still used quite frequently, but i don't cuss like it's my job as much recently. it's more like a volunteer position that happens not as often. hah. "effing" is also used entirely too much and i'm sure that the friends around may get annoyed with me at times, but EFF that. hah hah.

the whole brian thing is done. it's good though. he and i are two different people - easy to see now. religion and politics, ah geez. but i actually saw him the other night cause i hung out with wes, (that day was effing great btw). i hadn't talked to him really since he said he needed time which i think i've come to see as an easy out = boys are fucking dumb most of the time.  even when they're great guys, which brian is, they do stupid, thoughtless shit. but seeing him was good because i know there's nothing there. and i knew it before that, that he and i were done, but people said he'd call up an say i miss you or whatever. i knew that call wouldn't come, but the absence and distance of it all made me miss him because of the things i liked about him. as far as friends go though, i don't think he even wants to muster that, but i don't know what he's thinking really, he just appeared to want to be removed from me when i saw him last. it's good though. despite how much i really liked him, when i found something that i won't compromise myself on and i know he probably wouldn't either, it changed what we had because there's no future for two people who believe different things. i'm satisfied with it. 

other things are good. 

eric and i are getting closer, if that's possible and it's pretty friggin cool. he's always been a best friend of mine, but i'm learning more and more so i'm happy with that.

wes, e, neil, john, and me are getting our shit together. have our first practice/meeting on saturday. i'm stoked about that.

on the downside, despite these good things and some fun i've had, i'm in a rut. but most of the time the things i'm happy about do not supersede the feeling of shittiness i'm overcome with recently. i can hide it at class, or work, but it's getting harder to. i keep telling e that i just want a break, to get away. but i can't and that makes things worse, to think about my responsibilities and commitments. fuck. 

i've been spiraling further down as the days have been passing. i thought that i had no motivation for school, but i'm coming to find out that it's for life. and that's shitty, super shitty. i can't figure out what's wrong with me. i'm depressed with nothing to be depressed about. e, was trying to help me examine my life to find the culprit, but not finding anything just made me more frustrated and upset. i've no idea what to do. i'm back to feeling how i haven't felt in years. the way high school felt when i was so low. it effing sucks. so along with that feeling, though, comes the guilt i feel for being depressed for no reason when so many people are worse off than me and that doesn't make me feel any better. i'm at a loss about what to do here.

things are good. 

i fucking have no motivation for school. maybe i shouldn't have gone to beer cellar last night, but i needed the stress release badly and i ended up having so much fun. it fucking rocked cause i saw so many people. people i saw and only talked to, laughed with and/or danced with for a bit: matt s. / jake / dave and steve k / matt j / bauman / joel / brett. and then i spent a good chunk of time with the following separate groups: mark, abs, bunny, mercedes, mike, friends of theirs i don't know well / erin, gina, kim, seth, hank (from high school) / wes, joe, jeff, jeff's gf / laur, shauna. i had a great time. but i didn't go to classes today. it's shitty and i will not let myself do that again. fuck.

wes, eric, my myspace friend john, and i are gonna start a band. cover band. w00t. but as soon as wes gets his kit back to his house from jake's we're gonna have a practice without the bass player that we need. which will still be good and helpful. this should be fun.

working tonight. hoping that midpoint music fest will leave me with a good chunk of cash from tips, without making me feel like i'm fucking up. good luck, al.

nothing else is new. 

p.s. ang hope you feel better. sinuses suck most of the time for me too. boo!

i'm going to bed sometime soon hopefully. the net will not seduce me tonight. i dare say.

i'm off so i'm not up too late. -my clock is wrong-

night.

my body seems to be failing me. i think my immune system is just way down. i'm going to the doctor because it's gotten to hate me so. i would like to not have an ear ache and swollen glands and a ditch in my gum and fucking sinuses that pop my eye out.

anyway e and i had dinner at the good old olive garden and that was fantastic. i love it cause they've got my wine there. i swear it's flippin orgasmic for me. lambrusco. :) so buy me a bottle - i swear it's cheap. yum. hah hah.

i'm actually slightly hungry now but i must away to bed. i have class effing early and then it's straight to work. i already know before the dawn, that tomorrow is going to suck. at least maybe the rain will keep customers inside. but fuck i bet it will keep them away and i'll be poor. wait oh that's right, i already am. eff it. 

i'm out.

brian needs time. we finally talked and it was on aim no less which sucks but i guess is better at that same time. he's pretty conservative and it bothers him that i even have a relationship like that in my past, regardless of whether or not i'm a different person now. i don't know what needing time means, but like angel said, at least it's that.

i'm mad at myself for being mad at myself. hmmh. i'm mad at myself to begin with because of how it came up and the fact that it did. i'm here doing the whole "kicking myself in the ass about this" thing. lauren keeps telling me at least it's now though so it won't be even harder later and i know that's right, but then i'm an effing idiot sometimes and i think fuck...maybe if it were later he'd care to much about me to let it be this big of an issue. i don't know if that's true. it's just hard cause i really friggin like him and i feel like i screwed myself. i'm fearing him coming to me when he's ready and saying, "i can't do this."

it sucks cause i just want to see him and talk to him and kiss him and laugh because he's tickling me or saying something hilarious or making fun of me. i want to smile at his expressions. i want to hear him tell me i'm gorgeous/so fucking hot/beautiful and i want to stare into his eyes with his nose pressed against mine. i'm rationalizing the fact that i feel like this even though it was so early for us by the fact that we had these things despite it being so early for us.

eric's calling me when he gets back in town and we're gonna hang out. that will help. he called me when dave was playing it i was glad because i could actually hear it pretty well. it's funny cause he also left me a message of dave before that that wasn't as clear and dave was talking and i couldn't understand what he was saying, but i knew it was him. :) hah i know him well ha ha.

also looking forward to a call from angel. i was thinking last night about how lucky we are to be so far apart and still be best friends. she's still an incredible pillar in my life and i don't know what i'd do without her. i love you, angel! i know you'll help me be okay again with parts of me that i don't like right now.
